references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper introduces Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs), a foundational model in graph neural networks, which is frequently used as a baseline or component in many subsequent GNN models.
This paper is highly influential in graph contrastive learning, a self-supervised learning method for graph representation, and is extensively cited as a key method within the field.

references.paper_title: GCC: graph contrastive coding for graph neural network pre-training
references.reason: This paper introduces a graph contrastive coding method, GCC, which is also a fundamental technique in self-supervised graph representation learning and is frequently used as a comparison in many other works.

references.paper_title: Revisiting semi-supervised learning with graph embeddings
references.reason: This paper offers a significant improvement in semi-supervised learning, demonstrating an early approach to the general strategy of using graph embeddings for improved results.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This paper is crucial in the field of graph representation learning due to its focus on inductive learning, providing an essential method for handling unseen nodes in graphs, a crucial aspect for many real-world applications.
